description: This course introduces students to the history and art of ancient Greece.  It covers more
than two thousand years of Greek civilization, from the Bronze Age through the archaic,
classical, and Hellenistic periods.  The itinerary takes students to every major region
of Greece, with extended stays in Athens, Crete, the Peloponnese, and Thessaloniki. When not
visiting museums and archaeological sites, students have the opportunity to experience modern
Greek culture as well.  Offered during Interim in alternate years.  Apply through International
and Off-Campus Studies. Also counts toward ancient
